Name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Prior to works

Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall supply a method statement to the Engineer at least 10 working days before the supply of concrete to the project site. The method statement(s) shall clearly demonstrate that the Concrete Supplier and Contractor have carefully considered the Quality Assurance requirements, requirements of this Specification.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Reinforcing cover to formwork
Acceptance Criteria - TABLE 20.2.2: CONCRETE EXPOSURE CLASSIFICATION — MINIMUM COVER FOR 100 YEAR DESIGN LIFE
Exposure Classification || Specified Compressive Strength (f'c) — 30 MPa, 40 MPa, 50 MPa
2.03 - Reinforcing & Formwork - Reo placement and bar bending
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Reo placement and bar bending
Specification Reference - Ensure reinforcing bends comform to NZ standards and project specifications
Acceptance Criteria - Bars shall be cut and bent in accordance with NZS 3109 to the shapes indictated in the drawings and placed correctly in the arrangement shown;
○ Unless noted on drawings reinforcing bars to be bent to min bend diameters outlined in NZS3101;
○ Heat bending of bars is prohibited
Verifying Document - Pre-Pour Inspection, Bar bending schedule
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Formwork
Acceptance Criteria - Formwork to be constructed so that finished concrete will be to the shape, lines and levels shown on the drawings;
○ All forms shall be designed such that exposed concrete edges have a min 20mm chamfer unless otherwise indicated on the drawing;
○ Interior surfaces of the forms shall be treated with a release agent. Any reinforcement in contact with the release agent shall be cleaned thoroughly;
○ Forms to be sufficiently watertight to prevent grout loss
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Pre-pour Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Pre-pour inspection - Engineer acceptance
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Formwork and Pour
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Concrete Placement
Specification Reference - AS/NZS 4671: 2001, 'NZS 3109, 26.1.16 Handling and Placing
Acceptance Criteria - Provide a minimum of 24 hours notice of each initial intention to place concrete to the engineer.
○ Concreting to be a continous operation between ends of members and/or properly formed construction joints.
○ Concrete should be placed as close to its final position as practical and drop height shall not exceed 2m.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Concrete Test Cylinders
Acceptance Criteria - A set of specimens for compression tests shall consist of 3 specimens from each sample of concrete. 1no. tested at 7 days and 2no. tested at 28 days.
○ Strength of concrete = Dependent on Mix Design.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Approved Concrete Mix Design
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm correct mix design brought to site
○ Concrete placement method that the mix was designed for - Pump Mix
○ Type of supplementary cementitious materials (if used);
○ Slump (target and actual slump when measured);
○ Associated Products e.g. cement and additives
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Slump Test
Acceptance Criteria - Slump tests shall be taken for each truckload of concrete and when compressive testing samples are taken. Slump spread test if slump could exceed 210mm.
Nominated slump (mm) || Tolerance for snatch sample (mm)
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Time Limits
Acceptance Criteria - Incorporated in the works within 90minutes of batching.
○ Incorporated in the works within 30minutes of discharge from concrete truck/agitator
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Concrete Vibration
Acceptance Criteria - All compaction of concrete shall be carried out in accordance with Clause 7.6 of NZS 3109 as further modified by the following provisions: -
○ All concrete shall be thoroughly compacted during and immediately after depositing, by means of power driven immersion vibrators of a size suitable for the section being poured.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Curing
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete to be cured for min 3 days;
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Survey as-built
Acceptance Criteria - As-built survey CAD File
Verifying Document - As-built survey CAD File
Customer Requirements Verification Record / Location/ Hold Points
